metadata.description: A visual flow-based development platform for building and deploying language model applications - COMPLETE with RBAC enhancement

schema.name: User
schema.graphql_schema:
type User {
  id: ID!
  username: String! @unique
  password: String!
  profile_image: String
  is_active: Boolean!
  is_superuser: Boolean!
  is_verified: Boolean
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
  last_login_at: DateTime
  flows: [Flow!]! @relation(name: "UserFlows")
  folders: [Folder!]! @relation(name: "UserFolders")
  apiKeys: [ApiKey!]! @relation(name: "UserApiKeys")
  variables: [Variable!]! @relation(name: "UserVariables")
  flowRuns: [FlowRun!]! @relation(name: "UserFlowRuns")
  roleAssignments: [RoleAssignment!]! @relation(name: "UserRoleAssignments")
}

schema.name: Flow
schema.graphql_schema:
type Flow {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
  data: JSON!
  is_component: Boolean!
  icon: String
  icon_bg_color: String
  gradient: String
  updated_at: DateTime!
  webhook: Boolean
  endpoint_name: String @unique
  is_public: Boolean!
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserFlows")
  folder: Folder @relation(name: "FolderFlows")
  flowRuns: [FlowRun!]! @relation(name: "FlowRuns")
  messages: [Message!]! @relation(name: "FlowMessages")
}

schema.name: Folder
schema.graphql_schema:
type Folder {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
  parent_folder_id: ID
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserFolders")
  flows: [Flow!]! @relation(name: "FolderFlows")
  parent: Folder @relation(name: "FolderHierarchy")
  children: [Folder!]! @relation(name: "FolderHierarchy")
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: ApiKey
schema.graphql_schema:
type ApiKey {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  api_key: String! @unique
  created_at: DateTime!
  last_used_at: DateTime
  total_uses: Int!
  is_active: Boolean!
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserApiKeys")
  flows: [Flow!]!
}

schema.name: FlowRun
schema.graphql_schema:
type FlowRun {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  flow: Flow! @relation(name: "FlowRuns")
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserFlowRuns")
  status: FlowRunStatus!
  inputs: JSON
  outputs: JSON
  logs: JSON
  artifacts: JSON
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

enum FlowRunStatus {
  PENDING
  RUNNING
  SUCCESS
  FAILED
  CANCELLED
}

schema.name: Variable
schema.graphql_schema:
type Variable {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  value: String
  default_value: String
  type: VariableType!
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserVariables")
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

enum VariableType {
  STRING
  NUMBER
  BOOLEAN
  JSON
  SECRET
}

schema.name: Message
schema.graphql_schema:
type Message {
  id: ID!
  text: String!
  sender: MessageSender!
  sender_name: String!
  session_id: String!
  timestamp: DateTime!
  flow: Flow @relation(name: "FlowMessages")
  files: [String!]
}

enum MessageSender {
  USER
  MACHINE
  AI
  SYSTEM
}

schema.name: Vertex
schema.graphql_schema:
type Vertex {
  id: ID!
  display_name: String!
  description: String
  base_type: ComponentType!
  inputs: [VertexInput!]!
  outputs: [VertexOutput!]!
  params: JSON
  frozen: Boolean!
  is_input: Boolean!
  is_output: Boolean!
  is_state: Boolean!
  edges: [Edge!]! @relation(name: "VertexEdges")
}

schema.name: Edge
schema.graphql_schema:
type Edge {
  id: ID!
  source: Vertex! @relation(name: "EdgeSource")
  target: Vertex! @relation(name: "EdgeTarget")
  source_handle: String!
  target_handle: String!
  data: JSON
}

schema.name: Component
schema.graphql_schema:
type Component {
  id: ID!
  display_name: String!
  description: String!
  icon: String
  category: ComponentCategory!
  inputs: [ComponentInput!]!
  outputs: [ComponentOutput!]!
  code: String!
  template: JSON
  documentation: String
  beta: Boolean!
  experimental: Boolean!
}

enum ComponentCategory {
  INPUT_OUTPUT
  TEXT_PROCESSING
  AGENTS
  CHAINS
  DATA
  EMBEDDINGS
  LLMS
  MEMORIES
  TOOLS
  RETRIEVERS
  LOGIC
  HELPERS
  CUSTOM
}

schema.name: Template
schema.graphql_schema:
type Template {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String!
  data: JSON!
  category: String!
  icon: String
  gradient: String
  is_public: Boolean!
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: Credential
schema.graphql_schema:
type Credential {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  provider: String!
  encrypted_data: String!
  user: User!
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: Transaction
schema.graphql_schema:
type Transaction {
  id: ID!
  flow_run: FlowRun!
  transaction_id: String! @unique
  status: TransactionStatus!
  error: String
  params: JSON
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

enum TransactionStatus {
  PENDING
  IN_PROGRESS
  COMPLETED
  FAILED
  ROLLED_BACK
}

schema.name: Store
schema.graphql_schema:
type Store {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
  data: JSON!
  is_public: Boolean!
  user: User!
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: GlobalVariable
schema.graphql_schema:
type GlobalVariable {
  id: ID!
  name: String! @unique
  value: String!
  type: VariableType!
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: Role
schema.graphql_schema:
type Role {
  id: ID!
  name: String! @unique
  display_name: String!
  description: String!
  is_system: Boolean!
  permissions: [Permission!]! @relation(name: "RolePermissions")
  assignments: [RoleAssignment!]! @relation(name: "RoleAssignments")
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: Permission
schema.graphql_schema:
type Permission {
  id: ID!
  name: String! @unique
  resource_type: ResourceType!
  action: ActionType!
  scope: PermissionScope!
  description: String!
  roles: [Role!]! @relation(name: "RolePermissions")
  created_at: DateTime!
}

enum ResourceType {
  FLOW
  COMPONENT
  ENVIRONMENT
  WORKSPACE
  API_TOKEN
  USER
  ROLE
}

enum ActionType {
  CREATE
  READ
  UPDATE
  DELETE
  EXECUTE
  EXPORT
  DEPLOY
  INVITE
  MANAGE
}

enum PermissionScope {
  GLOBAL
  WORKSPACE
  PROJECT
  RESOURCE
}

schema.name: RoleAssignment
schema.graphql_schema:
type RoleAssignment {
  id: ID!
  user: User! @relation(name: "UserRoleAssignments")
  role: Role! @relation(name: "RoleAssignments")
  scope_type: ScopeType!
  scope_id: String
  assigned_by: User!
  assigned_at: DateTime!
  expires_at: DateTime
  is_active: Boolean!
}

enum ScopeType {
  GLOBAL
  WORKSPACE
  PROJECT
  FLOW
}

schema.name: AuditLog
schema.graphql_schema:
type AuditLog {
  id: ID!
  user: User!
  action: String!
  resource_type: String!
  resource_id: String
  old_values: JSON
  new_values: JSON
  ip_address: String
  user_agent: String
  timestamp: DateTime!
  session_id: String
}

schema.name: Workspace
schema.graphql_schema:
type Workspace {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
  owner: User!
  is_active: Boolean!
  settings: JSON
  created_at: DateTime!
  updated_at: DateTime!
}

schema.name: ServiceAccount
schema.graphql_schema:
type ServiceAccount {
  id: ID!
  name: String!
  description: String
  api_key: String! @unique
  is_active: Boolean!
  permissions: [Permission!]!
  created_by: User!
  created_at: DateTime!
  last_used_at: DateTime
}

schema.name: ResourcePermission
schema.graphql_schema:
type ResourcePermission {
  id: ID!
  resource_type: String!
  resource_id: String!
  user: User!
  permission: Permission!
  granted_by: User!
  granted_at: DateTime!
  expires_at: DateTime
  is_active: Boolean!
}

test.name: FlowCreationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Flow Creation
  As a user
  I want to create new flows
  So that I can build language model applications

  Scenario: Create a new flow successfully
    Given I am authenticated as a user
    And I am on the home page
    When I click on "New Flow" button
    And I enter "My Test Flow" as the flow name
    And I add a ChatInput component
    And I add an OpenAI component
    And I connect the components
    And I click "Save"
    Then the flow should be saved successfully
    And I should see "Flow saved" notification
    And the flow should appear in my flow list

  Scenario: Handle duplicate flow names
    Given I have an existing flow named "MyFlow"
    When I create a new flow with the same name
    Then the system should auto-increment the name to "MyFlow (1)"
    And save the flow with the new name

test.name: UserAuthenticationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: User Authentication
  As a user
  I want to log in securely
  So that I can access my flows

  Scenario: Successful login
    Given I am on the login page
    When I enter valid credentials
    And I click "Sign In"
    Then I should be redirected to the home page
    And I should see my user profile

  Scenario: Failed login with invalid credentials
    Given I am on the login page
    When I enter invalid credentials
    And I click "Sign In"
    Then I should see an error message
    And I should remain on the login page

  Scenario: Auto-login functionality
    Given I previously logged in with "Keep me logged in" checked
    When I visit the application
    Then I should be automatically authenticated
    And redirected to the home page

test.name: FlowExecutionTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Flow Execution
  As a user
  I want to execute my flows
  So that I can test my language model applications

  Scenario: Execute a simple flow
    Given I have a flow with ChatInput and ChatOutput
    And the flow is properly connected
    When I click the "Run" button
    And I enter "Hello" in the chat input
    Then the flow should execute successfully
    And I should see the response in the output

  Scenario: Handle execution errors
    Given I have a flow with missing API keys
    When I try to execute the flow
    Then I should see an error message about missing credentials
    And the execution should stop gracefully

test.name: ApiIntegrationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: API Integration
  As a developer
  I want to access flows via API
  So that I can integrate with external systems

  Scenario: Execute flow via API
    Given I have a valid API key
    And I have a published flow with endpoint "my-flow"
    When I send a POST request to "/api/v1/run/my-flow"
    With valid input data
    Then I should receive a 200 response
    And the response should contain the flow output

  Scenario: API authentication failure
    Given I have an invalid API key
    When I send a request to any API endpoint
    Then I should receive a 401 Unauthorized response

test.name: ComponentLoadingTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Dynamic Component Loading
  As the system
  I want to load components dynamically
  So that I can optimize performance

  Scenario: Load component on first access
    Given a component has not been loaded
    When the component is accessed
    Then it should be dynamically imported
    And cached for future use

  Scenario: Use cached component
    Given a component has been previously loaded
    When the component is accessed again
    Then it should be retrieved from cache
    And not re-imported

test.name: GraphCycleTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Graph Cycle Detection
  As the graph engine
  I want to detect and handle cycles
  So that flows don't run infinitely

  Scenario: Detect simple cycle
    Given a graph with vertices A -> B -> C -> A
    When the graph is prepared
    Then is_cyclic should be true
    And cycle vertices should be identified

  Scenario: Execute cyclic graph with max iterations
    Given a cyclic graph
    And max_iterations is set to 5
    When the graph is executed
    Then it should stop after 5 iterations
    And raise a "Max iterations reached" error

test.name: UserIsolationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: User Data Isolation
  As the system
  I want to isolate user data
  So that users cannot access each other's resources

  Scenario: Prevent cross-user flow access
    Given User A has created a flow
    When User B tries to access User A's flow
    Then access should be denied
    And a 403 Forbidden response should be returned

  Scenario: Filter flows by user
    Given multiple users have flows in the system
    When a user requests their flow list
    Then only their own flows should be returned
    And no other user's flows should be visible

test.name: WebSocketConnectionTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: WebSocket Communication
  As the system
  I want to maintain WebSocket connections
  So that I can provide real-time updates

  Scenario: Establish WebSocket connection
    Given a client wants real-time updates
    When the client connects to the WebSocket endpoint
    Then a connection should be established
    And the client should receive a connection confirmation

  Scenario: Handle connection loss
    Given an active WebSocket connection
    When the connection is lost
    Then the client should attempt to reconnect
    And restore the session state upon reconnection

test.name: FileUploadTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: File Upload
  As a user
  I want to upload files
  So that I can use them in my flows

  Scenario: Upload valid file
    Given I have a PDF file under 10MB
    When I upload the file
    Then the file should be accepted
    And stored in the system
    And associated with my account

  Scenario: Reject oversized file
    Given I have a file larger than 10MB
    When I try to upload the file
    Then the upload should be rejected
    And I should see an error message about file size

test.name: TemplateInstantiationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Template Usage
  As a user
  I want to use templates
  So that I can quickly create flows

  Scenario: Create flow from template
    Given I am on the templates page
    When I select the "Basic Prompting" template
    And click "Use Template"
    Then a new flow should be created
    And it should contain the template components
    And be ready for customization

test.name: ApiKeyManagementTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: API Key Management
  As a user
  I want to manage my API keys
  So that I can control API access

  Scenario: Create new API key
    Given I am on the API keys settings page
    When I click "Create New Key"
    And enter a key name
    Then a new API key should be generated
    And displayed once for copying
    And added to my key list

  Scenario: Revoke API key
    Given I have an active API key
    When I click "Revoke" on the key
    Then the key should be deactivated
    And API calls with that key should fail

test.name: FlowSharingTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Flow Sharing
  As a user
  I want to share my flows
  So that others can use them

  Scenario: Generate share link
    Given I have a flow
    When I click the "Share" button
    And select "View Only" access
    Then a unique share link should be generated
    And the link should provide read-only access

  Scenario: Access shared flow
    Given I have a share link for a flow
    When I access the link
    Then I should see the flow in read-only mode
    And not be able to make changes

test.name: ErrorHandlingTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Error Handling
  As the system
  I want to handle errors gracefully
  So that users have a good experience

  Scenario: Handle component execution error
    Given a component that throws an error
    When the component is executed
    Then the error should be caught
    And logged with context
    And a user-friendly message should be shown

  Scenario: Handle network timeout
    Given a slow network request
    When the request times out
    Then a timeout error should be raised
    And the user should be notified
    And given option to retry

test.name: DataPersistenceTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: Data Persistence
  As the system
  I want to persist data reliably
  So that user work is not lost

  Scenario: Auto-save flow changes
    Given I am editing a flow
    When I make changes to the flow
    Then the changes should be auto-saved
    And persisted to the database
    And recoverable after refresh

  Scenario: Handle save conflicts
    Given two users editing the same flow
    When both try to save simultaneously
    Then conflict should be detected
    And users should be notified
    And given options to resolve

test.name: PerformanceTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: System Performance
  As the system
  I want to maintain good performance
  So that users have a responsive experience

  Scenario: Load large flow quickly
    Given a flow with 100+ components
    When the flow is loaded
    Then it should load within 3 seconds
    And be interactive within 5 seconds

  Scenario: Handle concurrent executions
    Given 10 flows running simultaneously
    When all flows are executing
    Then system should remain responsive
    And complete all executions successfully

test.name: RBACRoleAssignmentTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: RBAC Role Assignment
  As an admin
  I want to assign roles to users
  So that I can control access permissions

  Scenario: Assign role to user
    Given I am logged in as an admin
    And there is a user "testuser"
    And there is a role "Editor"
    When I assign the "Editor" role to "testuser"
    Then the user should have Editor permissions
    And the assignment should be logged in audit trail

  Scenario: Remove role from user
    Given a user has the "Editor" role
    When I remove the "Editor" role from the user
    Then the user should lose Editor permissions
    And the change should be audited

test.name: RBACPermissionCheckTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: RBAC Permission Checking
  As the system
  I want to check user permissions
  So that I can enforce access control

  Scenario: Check flow edit permission
    Given a user with "Editor" role
    When the user tries to edit a flow
    Then the permission check should pass
    And the action should be allowed

  Scenario: Deny unauthorized access
    Given a user with "Viewer" role
    When the user tries to delete a flow
    Then the permission check should fail
    And access should be denied

test.name: RBACAuditLoggingTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: RBAC Audit Logging
  As a compliance officer
  I want all RBAC actions to be logged
  So that I can audit system access

  Scenario: Log role assignment
    Given a role assignment action
    When the role is assigned to a user
    Then an audit log entry should be created
    And include user, role, assigner, and timestamp

  Scenario: Query audit logs
    Given multiple audit log entries exist
    When I query logs for a specific user
    Then I should get all actions for that user
    And results should be paginated

test.name: RBACWorkspaceIsolationTest
test.gherkin:
Feature: RBAC Workspace Isolation
  As a system administrator
  I want workspace-scoped permissions
  So that users can only access their workspace resources

  Scenario: Enforce workspace boundaries
    Given user A has access to workspace 1
    And user B has access to workspace 2
    When user A tries to access workspace 2 resources
    Then access should be denied
    And the attempt should be logged

  Scenario: Cross-workspace admin access
    Given a global admin user
    When the admin accesses any workspace
    Then access should be allowed
    And actions should be audited with admin context

edges.label: calls
edges.details: Auth store calls user service for authentication

edges.label: starts
edges.details: Flow page triggers flow execution engine

edges.label: calls
edges.details: Flow store calls flow service for CRUD operations

edges.label: persists
edges.details: Flow service persists flow data to database

edges.label: exports
edges.details: API modal generates code for flow

edges.label: renders
edges.details: Flow grid displays individual flow cards

edges.label: stores
edges.details: API keys store manages API key data

edges.label: utilizes
edges.details: Settings page uses API keys store

edges.label: utilizes
edges.details: Settings page uses dark mode store

edges.label: stores
edges.details: File upload process stores files in user store

edges.label: assigned_via
edges.details: Role assigned to users via assignments

edges.label: performed_by
edges.details: Audit log records actions performed by user

edges.label: owned_by
edges.details: Workspace is owned by a user

edges.label: manages
edges.details: Admin page manages user role assignments

edges.label: creates
edges.details: Audit service creates audit log entries

edges.label: checks_permissions
edges.details: API handler checks permissions via authorization service

edges.label: validates_access
edges.details: Flow service validates access via authorization service
